item.title: HElP with port and server java
item.dc:creator: @Zenzie Zenzie
item.description:
@Zenzie wrote:

Go to server.java the notepath file

press same time Ctrl + F

fill in the box

public static int serverlistenerPort =

next to that you’ll see yoru port … Change it to the wanted one.

item.title: HElP with port and server java
item.dc:creator: @I_Br3ndan_I I Br3ndan I
item.description:
@I_Br3ndan_I wrote:

What? There is no ‘default port’ in you’re source file, every port can be and probably is different. We only call 43594 the default because that’s what the MoparScape client/webclient listens to automatically. His port may not be 43594, that’s why he maybe can’t find it.

Maybe he doesn’t even have a source. -.-

Read full topic
item.source: HElP with port and server java

item.title: HElP with port and server java
item.dc:creator: @Taylor_John0 Taylor John0
item.description:
@Taylor_John0 wrote:

…
lets go through this
open server.java
search

43594

you should see

public static int serverlistenerPort = 43594; //43594=default

change

serverlistenerPort = 43594;

to whatever port u want
DON’T FORGET TO SET ROUTER RULES FOR YOUR NEW PORT

br3ndan my buddy hey
he’s seachin for the default port not his port :]

Read full topic
item.source: HElP with port and server java

item.title: HElP with port and server java
item.dc:creator: @I_Br3ndan_I I Br3ndan I
item.description:
@I_Br3ndan_I wrote:

The port may not be 43594. Search whatever port you’re server runs on. Could be 5555, 1337, anything. Just double-click runserver.BAT and see what port you’re server runs on, then go into server.java and search it, change it to whatever number, aslong as it’s below 60000.

Read full topic
